Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery closed vessel, possibly an oinochoe; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of possible deer to right (shoulder with incised flecks and added red on neck remaining).
Producer name: Attributed to the Circle of: Sophilos ((Bakir))
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
See also Bakir, G., Sophilos, ein Beitrag zu seinem Stil. Mainz 1981, pl. 84, fig. 176, no. B27.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 455, no. B764)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 225, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0308) (Phase 1)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
